text: Bernardo O'Higgins Riquelme (1778–1842) was a Chilean independence leader. Along with José de San Martín, he is credited with liberating Chile from Spanish rule. Although he was the second Supreme Director of Chile (1817-1823), he is considered one of Chile's founding fathers. He was also the first leader of a fully independent Chilean state. Category:1778 births Category:1842 deaths Category:Chilean politicians Category:People from Bío Bío Region
title: Bernardo O'Higgins
